details.description: You must tell DVLA about a blood clot on the brain - download the correct form to let them know
details.body:
You must tell DVLA if you have a blood clot in the brain.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car, motorcycle, bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA if you have a blood clot in the brain. Fill in form B1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

You don’t have to tell DVLA if you have a blood clot in your lung.

Download ‘B1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 306KB)
